author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Crime Branch CID of the State police on Thursday apprehended three persons who were in possession of counterfeit currency notes with a face value of Rs. 9.99 lakh.

According to police sources, on a tip-off that some persons were planning to smuggle counterfeit currency from West Bengal to Tamil Nadu by train, a special team was deployed at railway stations. Three persons who arrived by Guwahati-Bangalore Express at Korukkupet were intercepted by the team.

The trio — Abdul Ismail (25) of Mannadi, Rizwan Sheriff (28) of Chepauk and Mohammed Rafiq (26) of Perungulathur were in possession of the counterfeit currency of Rs. 1,000 and Rs. 500 denomination.

Based on a report of the Organised Crime Intelligence Unit, the CBCID registered a case. The accused revealed that they procured the counterfeit currency from a person in Malda District of West Bengal. They were remanded to judicial custody.
title: Counterfeit currency seized
